abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Health Sector
            Support Project for Guinea is to help decrease maternal and
            infant mortality rates by: (a) avoiding the death of at
            least 12,000 pregnant women, and (b) avoiding the death of
            27,500 children. The reallocation is necessary to finance
            additional training following the cancellation of the
            acquisition of equipment for the planned reproductive health
            training and research center since its construction has been
            suspended by the authorities following issues with
            construction contracts. Therefore, the center will not be
            completed before the end of the project. Since the center
            was to train midwives, it was agreed with the Government to
            use the funds initially allocated for the equipment of the
            center (SDR2.5 million) to training activities for nurses in
            obstetrics and goods and services. In addition to the
            Bank's agreement to the reallocation, government will
            be informed that the project is eligible to the standard
            4-month disbursement grace period, which for the project
            will be from January 1, 2014 to April 30, 2014.
